backend.src.app.repositories.rentals package

Submodules

backend.src.app.repositories.rentals.rental_repository module

class backend.src.app.repositories.rentals.rental_repository.RentalRepository(rental_id)[source]

Bases: object

The RentalRepository class encapsulates the logic necessary to access the database and perform CRUD operations on the Rental model.

Variables:

  • rental_id – Unique identifier of the rental.

  • rental – Instance of Rental model.

close(close_data)[source]

Close the current rental instance in the database.

Parameters:

close_data (dict[str, any]) – Dictionary containing new values for the rental’s attributes.

Returns:

Returns True if the closure was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

delete()[source]

Delete the current rental instance from the database.

get_rental()[source]

Retrieve the current rental instance.

Returns:

Returns the current rental instance or None if it doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Rental or None

get_rental_all_data()[source]

Retrieve all data of the current rental instance.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing all data of the current rental instance. Contains following keys: - id (int): The rental’s ID. - date_start (datetime.datetime): The rental’s start date. - date_end (datetime.datetime): The rental’s end date. - payment_type (str): The rental’s payment type. - base_price (int): The rental’s base price. - is_closed (bool): The rental’s status. - damage_fee (int): The rental’s damage fee. - late_return_fee (int): The rental’s late return fee. - description (str): The rental’s description. - employee_id (int): The ID of the employee who managed the rental. - client_id (int): The ID of the client who made the rental.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

get_rental_equipments()[source]

Retrieve the list of equipment IDs related to the current rental.

Returns:

A list of equipment IDs related to the current rental.

Return type:

list[int]

get_rental_full_data()[source]

Retrieve full data of the current rental instance including rented equipments info.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing all data of the current rental instance. Contains following keys: - id (int): The rental’s ID. - date_start (datetime): The rental’s start date. - date_end (datetime): The rental’s end date. - payment_type (str): The rental’s payment type. - base_price (int): The rental’s base price. - is_closed (bool): The rental’s status. - damage_fee (int): The rental’s damage fee. - late_return_fee (int): The rental’s late return fee. - description (str): The rental’s description. - employee_id (int): The ID of the employee who managed the rental. - client_id (int): The ID of the client who made the rental. - equipments (list[int]): The list of rented equipments IDs.

Return type:

dict[str, any]

save()[source]

Save the current rental instance to the database.

update(update_data)[source]

Update the current rental instance based on the provided update data.

Parameters:

update_data (dict[str, any]) – Dictionary containing new values for the rental’s attributes.

Returns:

Returns True if the update was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

backend.src.app.repositories.rentals.rentals_repository module

class backend.src.app.repositories.rentals.rentals_repository.RentalsRepository(create_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The RentalsRepository class provides methods for creating, retrieving, and sorting Rental objects.

This class acts as a repository and uses the Rental model to perform operations related to rentals.

create()[source]

Creates a Rental instance.

This method takes a dictionary containing information about a rental, validates this data, and if valid, creates a Rental instance in the database. It also records the ID of the newly created rental instance.

Returns:

True if the input data is valid and the Rental instance is created in the database, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_all()[source]

Retrieves all Rental instances.

This method fetches all Rental instances from the database, and stores them in memory for future sorting.

Returns:

A list of all Rental instances fetched from the database.

Return type:

list[Rental]

get_rental_id()[source]

Retrieve the ID of the last rental created by this repository instance.

Returns:

The ID of the last rental created, or None if no rental has been created.

Return type:

int or None

sort_all(sort_data)[source]

Sorts all Rental instances based on the provided sorting parameters.

This method takes a dictionary specifying how rentals should be sorted and returns a sorted list of all Rental instances from the in-memory data.

Parameters:

sort_data (dict[str, any]) – Dictionary containing the sorting parameters.

Returns:

A sorted list of all in-memory Rental instances if the sorting parameters are valid, None otherwise.

Return type:

list[Rental] or None
